isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Adjustments - Check and Adjust Wheel Bearings

warning.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface. Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip and fall over. Serious personal injury can result.

step1.para: Raise the vehicle so that the wheels are off the floor. Support the vehicle with safety stands.
Remove the capscrews and remove the gasket and the cap from the hub.
Verify that that the brake drum and the hub fasteners are tightened to the manufacturer's specifications.

Attach a dial indicator with the magnetic base at the bottom of the hub or the brake drum. Adjust the dial indicator so that the pointer is against the center of the knuckle. Set the dial indicator on 'zero' (Figure 58).

note.para: Do not push/pull at the top and the bottom of the hub or drum. Pushing or pulling at the top and the bottom will not give a true reading of the end play.

step1.para: Measure the end play by pushing/pulling on each side of the hub or drum while looking at the dial indicator. The end play is the total travel observed. If the end play is not within 0.001- to 0.010-inch (0.025-0.254 mm), adjust the wheel bearings (Figure 58).
If necessary, adjust the wheel bearings. Refer to Steps 7-9.
Remove the outer adjusting nut and lock washer from the spindle.

figure.caption: Figure 59. Remove Outer Adjusting Nut and Lock Washer

note.para: When removing or installing the adjusting nuts, use the correct wrench socket to avoid damaging the adjusting nuts.

step1.para: Use a torque wrench to tighten the inner adjusting nut to 100 lbf-ft (136 Nm) while rotating the tire in both directions (Figure 60)

calloutgroup.callout1: Step 1. Tighten nut to 100 lbf-ft (136 Nm).
Step 3. Install lock washer and outer adjusting nut.
Step 4. Tighten nut to 250 - 400 lbf-ft (339 - 542 Nm).

caution.para: Do not strike the adjusting nut with a metal hammer. Do not use a hammer and chisel or drift or loosen the adjusting nut. This will damage the nut.

step1.para: Install the lock washer and outer adjusting nut on the spindle. Tighten the outer adjusting nut to 250-400 lbf-ft (339-542 Nm) (Figure 60).
